newsitem.title: UK: Schroders jumps on vague bid talk.
newsitem.headline: Schroders jumps on vague bid talk.

text.p: Shares in British merchant bank Schroders Plc leapt in afternoon trading as vague bid talk re-emerged ahead of the company's results on Friday, traders said.
The shares hit 14.60 stg in modest volume, a rise of 90p on the day, before slipping back to trade at 14.40 stg by 1423 GMT on volume of 139,000 shares.
"We're seeing little bits of buying on continued interest around the bid speculation but there are no names being mentioned and there's no substance we can put to it," said one trader.
Others highlighted the volatile trading nature of the stock.
"The stock rarely moves but they certainly catch up when they do," said another trader.
Banking analysts are predicting a strong showing by the bank when it reports interim results on Friday with forecasts ranging between 106 and 125 million stg
